video.title: TEDTalks: Humanity's Future
video.synopsis: Bold predictions and stern warnings -- are we heading for a final countdown or a new frontier? These TED presenters peer into mankind's future.

episodes.synopsis: Games give players the means and incentive to save worlds, but can games solve real-world problems? Jane McGonigal says we can and explains how.
episodes.title: Jane McGonigal: Gaming Can Make a Better World

episodes.synopsis: Why do societies fail? Based on lessons from the past, Jared Diamond talks about the signs that collapse is near and how we can prevent it.
episodes.title: Jared Diamond on Why Societies Collapse

episodes.synopsis: Medical ethicist Harvey Fineberg shows us three paths for the ever-evolving human species. Neo-evolution is within our grasp. What will we do with it?
episodes.title: Harvey Fineberg: Are We Ready for Neo-Evolution?

episodes.synopsis: Inventor and visionary Ray Kurzweil explains why our brains will be reverse-engineered and nanobots will operate our consciousness by the 2020s.
episodes.title: Ray Kurzweil on How Technology Will Transform Us

episodes.synopsis: In order to create a world fit for the next generation, John Doerr says we need to invest now in clean energy or else we, as a planet, won't make it.
episodes.title: John Doerr Sees Salvation and Profit in Greentech

episodes.synopsis: A biotech ethicist looks forward to more meaningful (and controversial) technologies, like custom babies, whose adoption might drive human evolution.
episodes.title: Gregory Stock: To Upgrade Is Human

episodes.synopsis: Sir Martin Rees examines our planet and its future from a cosmic perspective, urging action to prevent dark consequences from scientific development.
episodes.title: Martin Rees Asks: Is This Our Final Century?

episodes.synopsis: How might the world end? Stephen Petranek lays out the challenges that face us in the drive to preserve the human race.
episodes.title: Stephen Petranek Counts Down to Armageddon

episodes.synopsis: As globalization and technological advances hurtle us to a new integrated future, Ian Goldin warns that not all people may benefit equally.
episodes.title: Ian Goldin: Navigating Our Global Future

episodes.synopsis: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita uses math to predict messy human events like war and political power shifts, and gives three predictions on Iran's future.
episodes.title: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita Predicts Iran's Future

episodes.synopsis: Technologist and futurist Bill Joy talks about several big worries for humanity and several big hopes in health, education and future tech.
episodes.title: Bill Joy: What I'm Worried About, What I'm Excited About

episodes.synopsis: Author Robert Wright explains how "non-zero-sumness," a network of linked fortunes and cooperation, can help save humanity today.
episodes.title: Robert Wright on Optimism

episodes.synopsis: Disaster-medicine expert Irwin Redlener reminds us that the threat of nuclear terror is real and looks at history to offer advice on how to survive.
episodes.title: Irwin Redlener on Surviving a Nuclear Attack

episodes.synopsis: At TED in 1998, the Rev. Billy Graham marvels at technology's power to change the world but says the end of evil comes after the world accepts Christ.
episodes.title: Billy Graham on Technology and Faith

episodes.synopsis: Given $50 billion to spend, would you solve AIDS or global warming? Danish political scientist Bjørn Lomborg comes up with surprising answers.
episodes.title: Bjorn Lomborg Sets Global Priorities

episodes.synopsis: Daniel Goldstein makes tools that help us imagine ourselves over time, so that we make smart choices for the "future us."
episodes.title: Daniel Goldstein: The Battle Between Your Present and Future Self
